com.ibm.opencard.access
Class MFCAccessConditions

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.ibm.opencard.access.MFCAccessConditions
public class MFCAccessConditions
extends java.lang.Object
implements AccessConditions

Represents the access conditions for a command class. Access conditions can require CHV, AUThentication, ENCryption or PROtection, or combinations thereof. Additionally, a CHV number and key number may be needed. Instances of this class are used by a MFCCardAccessor to determine the actions required to execute a command.
The access information for all command classes is coded in some status bytes that are returned on object selection. These bytes get parsed by a MFCAccessParser in order to create instances of this class. The access conditions for all of the command classes is composed by the class MFCAccessInformation.

This class supports MFC 4.1 cards and below. It may find some use with MFC 4.2 cards and above, but that is not yet sure.

Method Detail

requiresCHV

public final boolean requiresCHV()
Returns whether Card Holder Verification is required. The CHV number can be determined using getCHVNumber().
Returns:
true if CHV is required, false otherwise
See Also:
getCHVNumber()

requiresProtection

public final boolean requiresProtection()
Returns whether PROtection is required. If protection is required, the command and/or the response have to be protected by a MAC. The key needed for the MAC computation can be determined using getKeyNumber().
Returns:
true if protection is required, false otherwise
See Also:
getKeyNumber()

requiresAuthentication

public final boolean requiresAuthentication()
Returns whether AUThentication is required. The key needed for the authentication can be determined using getKeyNumber().
Returns:
true if authentication is required, false otherwise
See Also:
getKeyNumber()

requiresEncryption

public final boolean requiresEncryption()
Returns whether ENCryption is required. If encryption is required, part of the command and/or the response have to be encrypted. The key needed for the encryption can be determined using getKeyNumber().
Returns:
true if CHV is required, false otherwise
See Also:
getKeyNumber()

isNeverAccessible

public final boolean isNeverAccessible()
Returns whether an access is possible at all. MFC cards support the access conditions ALWays and NEVer. Neither of them requires any of the conditions mentioned above, but they still have to be distinguished. This method returns true iff the access condition is NEVer.
Returns:
true if the access condition is NEVer, false otherwise

getCHVNumber

public int getCHVNumber()
Returns the number of the CHV to perform. MFC cards support two Card Holder Verifications which are distinguished by their number, 1 or 2.
Returns:
1 for CHV1, 2 for CHV2

getKeyNumber

public int getKeyNumber()
Returns the number of the key to use. Keys are required for PROtection, AUThentication and ENCryption. The MFC cards support up to 4 keys to be used for these operations, numbered 0 to 3. This method returns the number of the key that has to be used to perform one of these functions. The actual key to be used depends on the key domain of the object to be accessed with the command.
Returns:
the number of the key to use (0 to 3)
See Also:
requiresAuthentication(), requiresProtection(), requiresEncryption()

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns a human-readable representation of this object.
Returns:
a string representing these access conditions
Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
